Created by [Adrian Anderson](https://www.linkedin.com/in/aanderson1017/) | [YouTube - Better Human Applications](https://www.youtube.com/@BetterHumanApplications)

item.name: Erp Data Integrations
Get all transaction metrics by file and dimension

variable.description: (Required) The locale to which the file is being uploaded.

query.description: The event type for which transaction metrics are fetched.
The name of the flow for which the service is being invoked.
The ledger for which transaction metrics are fetched.
The subledger application for which transaction metrics are fetched.
The time frame for which the transaction metrics are fetched. Valid values are 1, 2, 3, and so on. The number indicates the number of days. For example, 1 indicates one day and 2 indicates two days.

request.description: Returns the count of transactions processed for a given dimensions combination, such as ledger and event type in a given time frame.

response.name: Simple JSON containing transaction counts for a particular combination of dimensions in a particular timeframe

variable.description: (Required) The locale to which the file is being uploaded.

query.description: The event type for which transaction metrics are fetched.
The name of the flow for which the service is being invoked.
The ledger for which transaction metrics are fetched.
The subledger application for which transaction metrics are fetched.
The time frame for which the transaction metrics are fetched. Valid values are 1, 2, 3, and so on. The number indicates the number of days. For example, 1 indicates one day and 2 indicates two days.

variable.description: (Required) The locale to which the file is being uploaded.

query.description: The unique identifier of the file.
The type of file which is being downloaded.
The name of the flow for which the service is being invoked.
For internal use only.

request.description: Downloads all exceptions along with any invalid transactions.

item.name: Get all files uploaded in a specified time frame

The name of the flow for which the service is being invoked.
The time frame for which the transaction metrics are fetched. Valid values are 1, 2, 3, and so on. The number indicates the number of days. For example, 1 indicates one day and 2 indicates two days.

item.name: Get exception details for a transaction

variable.description: (Required) The locale to which the file is being uploaded.
(Required) The transaction number for which exception details are fetched.

query.description: The name of the flow for which the service is being invoked.
Indicates whether it's a reversal transaction.
The name of the subledger application associated with the transaction.
The time frame for which the transaction metrics are fetched. Valid values are 1, 2, 3, and so on. The number indicates the number of days. For example, 1 indicates one day and 2 indicates two days.

request.description: Returns details of the exceptions encountered for a given transaction.

variable.description: (Required) The locale to which the file is being uploaded.
(Required) The transaction number for which exception details are fetched.

query.description: The name of the flow for which the service is being invoked.
Indicates whether it's a reversal transaction.
The name of the subledger application associated with the transaction.
The time frame for which the transaction metrics are fetched. Valid values are 1, 2, 3, and so on. The number indicates the number of days. For example, 1 indicates one day and 2 indicates two days.

item.description: ERP Data Integrations allows you to connect and interact with external systems, services, or applications. You can initiate a file upload, import transactions, and trigger downstream accounting, and posting processes for the source system transactions.
